course_summary: This business course provides comprehensive guidance on effectively gauging candidate commitment and fulfilling legal responsibilities in recruitment. It covers strategies for initial candidate screening through open-ended questions to assess motivations, career goals, and salary expectations for both permanent and contract roles. The course also details critical compliance checks, such as right-to-work and industry-specific certifications, emphasizing due diligence to ensure legally sound placements and efficient use of recruiter and client time. [Merged from multiple video batches.]

agents.name: Candidate Data Capture Agent
agents.role: Collects initial CVs and basic candidate information from various sources (e.g., job board applications, direct submissions).

agents.name: Screening Call Scheduler Agent
agents.role: Automates the scheduling of initial screening calls between recruiters and candidates.
tools: Calendar scheduling software (e.g., Calendly, Microsoft Bookings)
outputs: Confirmed screening call time and link

agents.name: Eligibility Document Requester Agent
agents.role: Sends automated requests and reminders to candidates for necessary eligibility documents (e.g., passports, right-to-work documents, certifications).

agents.name: Document Storage & Tracking Agent
agents.role: Securely stores all received candidate documents and tracks their status (e.g., pending verification, verified, rejected).

agents.name: Candidate Database Update Agent
agents.role: Maintains and updates candidate profiles in the ATS/CRM with all collected information, including screening notes, feedback, and compliance status.

agents.name: Job Matching Engine Agent
agents.role: Identifies suitable job openings for candidates based on their updated profiles and client job descriptions.

agents.name: Application Preparer Agent
agents.role: Formats and compiles candidate CVs and other application materials according to client-specific requirements.

agents.name: Client Feedback Collector Agent
agents.role: Automates the collection of feedback from clients after candidate interviews.

agents.name: Recruitment Reporting Agent
agents.role: Generates comprehensive reports on recruitment metrics, pipeline status, placement rates, and compliance.
inputs: All agent and human node outputs (e.g., placement status, compliance rates)

agents.name: Candidate Sourcer
agents.role: Identifies potential candidates from various sources, including active and passive job seekers, leveraging job boards and social media.
outputs: List of potential candidates (Name, Contact Info, CV Link, Current Role, Current Company)

agents.name: Candidate Qualifier
agents.role: Screens candidate profiles against job requirements, assesses communication patterns, and flags potential matches or issues.
tools: Natural language processing for skills matching

agents.name: Outreach & Communication Handler
agents.role: Sends initial outreach messages, manages replies, schedules initial calls/interviews, and maintains ongoing candidate communication.
outputs: Candidate engagement status (interested, not interested, ghosted)
Request for additional info (e.g., passport for eligibility, landline)

agents.name: CV Submission Agent
agents.role: Prepares and sends candidate CVs and relevant profiles to clients for review.

agents.name: Interview Scheduler
agents.role: Manages the logistics of scheduling interviews between candidates and clients, sending confirmations and reminders.

agents.name: CRM Manager
agents.role: Updates and maintains all candidate and client data within the CRM system, tracking progress, interactions, and statuses.
inputs: All outputs from other agents and human nodes

agents.name: Referral Requestor
agents.role: Generates and sends automated requests for referrals to placed candidates, current clients, and other relevant contacts.

agents.name: LinkedIn Information Gatherer
agents.role: Extracts detailed information from LinkedIn profiles and company pages to enrich candidate and client profiles.

agents.name: Job Information Gathering
agents.role: Gathers and structures detailed job requirements from client input for both permanent and temporary roles.

agents.name: Candidate Sourcing
agents.role: Identifies potential candidates for both permanent and temporary roles based on structured job requirements.
outputs: List of potential candidate profiles (CVs, public profiles)

agents.name: Interview Questionnaire Preparation
agents.role: Prepares tailored interview questions to thoroughly vet candidates, focusing on motivations and practicalities.
outputs: Tailored interview questions (including probing questions for salary, commute, progression, benefits)

agents.name: Candidate Assessment
agents.role: Analyzes candidate interview responses and CVs to evaluate skills, experience, and initial suitability for a role.

agents.name: Candidate Motivation Analysis
agents.role: Extracts and categorizes deep-seated candidate motivations and potential deal-breakers from interview data.
outputs: Detailed candidate motivations (salary expectations, acceptance threshold, commute preferences, progression desires, team preferences, benefits)

agents.name: Candidate Presentation Preparation
agents.role: Compiles comprehensive candidate briefs for client review, highlighting relevant skills and motivations.
outputs: Client-ready candidate brief (CV, summary, vetting notes)

agents.name: Interview Scheduling
agents.role: Coordinates and schedules interviews between candidates and clients.

agents.name: Offer Analysis
agents.role: Compares client offers against candidate expectations and market data to support negotiation.

agents.name: Post-Offer Follow-up
agents.role: Automates tailored follow-up communications to candidates after an offer is extended.

agents.name: Contract Generation
agents.role: Generates employment contracts for temporary workers and service agreements with clients.

agents.name: Payroll Setup
agents.role: Sets up and manages payroll for temporary workers based on contract terms and hours worked.

agents.name: Invoice Generation
agents.role: Creates and issues invoices to clients for temporary placements based on hours worked and agreed margins.

agents.name: Financing Company Interface
agents.role: Manages all interactions with the financing company for invoice insurance, credit checks, and payment processing.

agents.name: Profit Tracking
agents.role: Monitors and reports on profit margins for all placements, analyzing revenue and costs.

agents.name: Candidate Relationship Management
agents.role: Manages ongoing communication and engagement with candidates before, during, and after placement.

agents.name: Client Relationship Management
agents.role: Manages ongoing communication and satisfaction with clients regarding recruitment services and candidate performance.

agents.name: Job Advertisement Creation Agent
agents.role: Creates and publishes job advertisements based on client requirements to attract suitable candidates.

agents.name: CV Screening Agent
agents.role: Filters and reviews raw candidate CVs against job requirements to identify suitable profiles.

agents.name: Candidate Information Capture Agent
agents.role: Records and structures candidate details, motivations, and feedback from human interactions.

agents.name: Document Generation Agent
agents.role: Generates templated documents such as interview question guides, interview confirmations, and offer letters.

agents.name: Email Automation Agent
agents.role: Sends automated or templated emails to candidates and clients for scheduling, follow-ups, and notifications.

agents.name: CRM Update Agent
agents.role: Updates the Customer Relationship Management system with the latest candidate and client interaction data.

agents.name: Payment Tracking Agent
agents.role: Monitors the status of generated invoices and tracks incoming payments.

agents.name: CRM & Communication Automation Agent
agents.role: Automate candidate and client communication (emails, reminders, notifications), manage scheduling, track all interactions, maintain candidate and client profiles, generate basic activity logs.

agents.name: Financial Management & Reporting Agent
agents.role: Handle all financial transactions, including invoicing, contractor payroll, expense tracking, tax calculations (VAT, Corporation Tax), and generation of financial reports (cash flow, budget, P&L). Facilitate invoice factoring.

agents.name: Business Registration & Compliance Agent
agents.role: Automate the formal registration of the business (e.g., Limited Company, VAT) with relevant government bodies.

agents.name: Lead Generation Agent
agents.role: Identifies potential companies based on industry criteria.

agents.name: Contact Information Lookup Agent
agents.role: Retrieves contact details (phone, email) for companies and specific roles.

agents.name: CRM Management Agent
agents.role: Records and updates lead/client information, call outcomes, and follow-up schedules.

agents.name: Email Outreach Agent
agents.role: Sends introductory, follow-up, and statement of account emails.

agents.name: Financial Calculation and Margin Analysis Agent
agents.role: Calculates potential margins, profits, and recommends optimal charge rates based on contractor pay, overheads, and the selected payment method's tax implications.

agents.name: Payroll Processing Agent
agents.role: Manages the processing of payroll for temporary workers according to their chosen payment method (PAYE, Umbrella) or facilitates payments to Limited Companies. It handles timesheet verification and calculates gross pay.
tools: Payroll software (e.g., Sonovate integration for financing)

agents.name: Tax Reporting and Compliance Agent
agents.role: Generates and, where applicable, submits necessary tax reports and ensures compliance with tax regulations for the recruitment company's direct employees (PAYE) or tracks compliance for other contractor types.

agents.name: Invoice Management Agent
agents.role: Generates and dispatches invoices to clients for services provided by temporary workers, tracks payment statuses, and manages invoice factoring if applicable.

agents.name: Job Posting
agents.role: Publishes job advertisements on relevant platforms.

agents.name: Initial Candidate Screening
agents.role: Filters candidates based on basic criteria from their applications.

agents.name: Contract & Rebate Tracking
agents.role: Monitors contract durations and calculates potential rebates or fee installments.

agents.name: Financial Calculator
agents.role: Computes profit margins, hourly rates, and take-home pay estimates for negotiation.

agents.name: Initial Candidate Screener
agents.role: Performs an automated preliminary screening of candidate profiles for basic qualifications, keyword matching, and active job-seeking status.

agents.name: Market Intelligence Capture Agent
agents.role: Collects, categorizes, and analyzes market data derived from candidate and client interactions, including industry trends, competitor pricing, and general hiring conditions.

agents.name: Client Lead Qualification Agent
agents.role: Processes information obtained from candidates about companies actively hiring or previously interviewed by candidates to generate qualified warm client leads.
inputs: Candidate feedback on companies currently hiring or previously interviewed from human_candidate_interview_deep_dive
outputs: Prioritized list of warm client leads with contextual information

agents.name: Financial Analysis Agent
agents.role: Calculates and presents the financial impact of different recruitment fee structures and potential salary reductions, providing data for negotiation.

agents.name: Job Brief Intake Agent
agents.role: Processes the detailed job brief provided by the human recruiter, extracting and structuring key requirements like role title, salary, experience, and specific skills for further processing.

agents.name: Candidate Sourcing & Research Agent
agents.role: Systematically identifies potential candidates based on the standardized job requirement profile. This includes searching job boards, professional networks (e.g., LinkedIn Recruiter), and internal databases.
outputs: List of potential candidate profiles (raw CVs, LinkedIn links, basic contact info)

agents.name: CV Preparation Agent
agents.role: Standardizes and formats candidate CVs to a consistent template, removing identifying information (if required) and highlighting relevant skills and experience as per the job brief for client presentation.
tools: Document formatting APIs (e.g., Google Docs API, Microsoft Word API)

agents.name: Communication Agent
agents.role: Manages automated initial outreach to potential candidates (e.g., email, LinkedIn messages) to gauge interest, share job details, and collect initial availability. It also handles routine client updates and information delivery.

agents.name: Reporting Agent
agents.role: Compiles and presents recruitment progress reports for internal tracking and client updates, including shortlist details, interview feedback summaries, and payment milestones. For retained searches, this includes confirmation of shortlist delivery as a payment trigger.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter conducts an initial screening call with the candidate. This involves asking open-ended questions about their reasons for leaving current/past roles, short-term and long-term career goals, and salary expectations. The aim is to gauge their motivation, passion, and genuine interest in a new opportunity or a specific role, as well as to assess cultural fit.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A screening call has been scheduled by the `agent_screening_scheduler`.
inputs_from_agents: Confirmed screening call time and link
outputs_for_agents: Detailed call notes (including commitment level assessment, key motivators, career aspirations, salary expectations)
Decision on whether to proceed with candidate

human_nodes.description: For PAYE contract roles (where the recruitment agency is responsible for payroll) or for clients with specific background check requirements (even for permanent roles), the recruiter manually verifies all eligibility and compliance documents (e.g., passports, visas, industry certifications). This is a critical step to ensure the candidate is legally allowed to work and meets all required standards, mitigating legal risks.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Required eligibility documents have been collected by the `agent_document_requester` and the candidate is being considered for a PAYE contract or has specific client requirements.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter engages in proactive and reactive communication to build and maintain strong relationships with candidates and clients. This includes following up on document requests, providing empathetic feedback for rejections, offering career advice, and addressing any complex or sensitive issues that arise during or after placement. This role focuses on long-term engagement and trust-building.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Ongoing throughout the recruitment cycle, or triggered by specific events such as document delays (from `agent_document_requester`), candidate concerns, or post-placement follow-ups.
outputs_for_agents: Relationship notes (e.g., candidate engagement level, client satisfaction)

human_nodes.description: After reviewing the candidate's updated profile and job matches, the recruiter makes the final decision on which candidates to present to the client. This involves exercising professional judgment to ensure the candidate's skills, experience, and commitment align perfectly with the client's needs and culture.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Potential job matches are identified by the `agent_job_matching_engine` and the candidate's profile is sufficiently complete and qualified.
outputs_for_agents: Approved candidate list for client submission

human_nodes.description: The recruiter provides personalized preparation for candidates before client interviews (e.g., advising on company culture, interview structure, key questions) and conducts a thorough debrief immediately after to gather their perceptions, performance, and continued interest, and provide immediate feedback.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client confirms an interview for a submitted candidate.
outputs_for_agents: Candidate debrief notes (including candidate's performance, continued interest, and questions for the client)

human_nodes.description: The recruiter expertly negotiates the terms of employment (salary, benefits, start date) between the client and the candidate, aiming for a mutually satisfactory agreement. This stage requires strong negotiation skills, understanding of market rates, and the ability to manage expectations from both sides.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client extends a formal job offer to a candidate.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter's primary role in managing personal stress and maintaining a positive, proactive mindset despite candidate ghosting or rejections. This involves quickly adapting, shifting focus, and initiating new sourcing efforts.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate goes missing, candidate rejects offer, client rejects candidate, candidate ghosts after confirming interest.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter conducts pre-interview calls with candidates, gathers specific information (e.g., eligibility documents like passport copies, alternative contact numbers), manages candidate expectations, and confirms their genuine interest.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate shows initial interest after initial outreach or client expresses interest in a candidate.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter engages in direct conversations with clients to understand their needs, discuss candidate profiles, gather feedback, and present replacement options when necessary.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Initial job requisition, client feedback on submitted CVs, candidate no-show/ghosting, need to present new candidates.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter handles salary and benefits negotiations between the candidate and the client, manages the offer process, and secures the final acceptance.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client decides to make an offer after successful interviews.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter confirms the candidate's start date and ensures all onboarding procedures are clear. This is a critical point to prevent last-minute drop-outs.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate accepts job offer.

human_nodes.description: The recruiter maintains a long-term relationship with clients, understanding their evolving needs, proactively presenting solutions, and addressing any issues. This includes regular check-ins and strategic discussions beyond immediate placements.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Successful placement, periodic client reviews, new hiring needs.

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter conducts the initial in-depth conversation with clients to capture precise job requirements, company culture, and role nuances that automation might miss. This is where active listening and relationship building occur.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A new job vacancy is identified, or a client expresses a need for recruitment services.

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter conducts personalized interviews with promising candidates. This involves asking prepared questions, probing deeper into responses, assessing soft skills, and understanding the candidate's true motivations and potential 'flakiness' for the role.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A list of potential candidates has been sourced and initial questionnaire prep is complete.
outputs_for_agents: Recruiter's qualitative assessment of candidate suitability

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter holds the initial consultation with clients for temporary staffing needs, clarifying role requirements, duration, and any specific client conditions for contract workers.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A client expresses a need for temporary or contract staff.

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter reviews the generated temporary employment contract and payment terms with the candidate, ensuring full understanding and addressing any questions before formal acceptance and placement.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A temporary candidate has been selected and a draft contract generated.

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter researches and selects suitable financing companies, establishing initial contact and liaising to set up the necessary agreements for invoice factoring and payroll services.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A decision is made to utilize a financing company for temporary placements.

human_nodes.description: The human makes high-level strategic decisions, reviews performance metrics, identifies opportunities or risks, and provides guidance for optimizing recruitment processes and business growth. This includes adjusting agency margins or shifting focus based on profit tracking and market insights.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Periodically (e.g., weekly, monthly) or upon significant changes in market conditions or internal performance metrics.
outputs_for_agents: Strategic directives (e.g., 'increase temp placements', 'adjust margins', 'focus on specialist roles')

human_nodes.description: Engages with clients to understand their hiring needs, build rapport, and negotiate recruitment terms. This is where job orders are initially taken.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Initial client contact or new hiring need identified by existing client.

human_nodes.description: Presents qualified candidate summaries to the client, highlighting their suitability and addressing specific client needs or concerns.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidates are qualified after internal interviews.

human_nodes.description: Coordinates and schedules client-candidate interviews, ensuring all parties are aware of the details and logistics.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client expresses interest in interviewing specific candidates.

human_nodes.description: Maintains regular personal contact with candidates throughout the process, providing updates, answering questions, and keeping them engaged.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: After any interaction (CV sent, interview scheduled, interview completed) or at scheduled intervals.

human_nodes.name: Candidate Closing Node
human_nodes.description: Persuades the candidate to accept the final offer by emphasizing how the role aligns with their deep motivations and career goals, using insights gathered earlier.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Final offer presented or candidate is hesitant.

human_nodes.description: Addresses issues like candidate disinterest, interview no-shows, or unsuccessful placements by communicating transparently with both client and candidate and determining next steps.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate becomes disengaged, misses an interview, or placement falls through.

human_nodes.description: This node is responsible for the foundational strategic decisions of the business. It involves defining the overall vision, mission, and long-term goals. It also determines the core business model (e.g., focus on permanent, contract, or a mix), designs the organizational structure, and sets initial financial targets. This is where the 'strawman' business plan is created. It also handles the legal aspects of allocating shares and determining dividend policy.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A new business is being started or a significant strategic pivot is required.

human_nodes.description: This node is the core of the recruitment consultancy's daily operations. It involves building and maintaining relationships with both clients and candidates. Key activities include candidate interview preparation, assessing candidate's true motivations and alternative offers (trial closing), educating clients on market realities and candidate expectations, and skillfully negotiating offers and counter-offers. It also includes personal touches like congratulatory calls and inviting new hires to company events to ensure a smooth transition and strong rapport.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate is ready for an interview, client expresses interest in a candidate, an offer is extended, a counter-offer is received.

human_nodes.description: This node performs regular oversight and strategic steering of the business. It analyzes the financial reports and performance data provided by agents, evaluates adherence to the business plan, and identifies areas for improvement or necessary adjustments to strategy (e.g., adjusting revenue targets, optimizing costs, refining the business model). It makes decisions on reinvestment of profits for growth, or dividend distribution based on the agreed financial strategy. It also involves making high-level decisions regarding scaling the business or managing significant financial events like securing invoice factoring.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Monthly, quarterly, or annual reporting cycles; significant deviations from financial forecasts; major market changes; decisions around investment or financial restructuring.

human_nodes.description: Makes initial cold calls, asks for the relevant contact person, handles initial objections, adapts tone, and attempts to get direct contact information (email, direct line).
human_nodes.trigger_condition: When a new company with basic contact info is available from agent_contact_info_lookup.

human_nodes.description: Conducts detailed conversations with qualified leads, gathers specific job requirements (e.g., machine types, shifts, programming experience), discusses and negotiates placement fees, and agrees on start dates.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: When a lead is identified as potentially serious and willing to engage further (e.g., email response, direct line obtained).

human_nodes.description: Reviews overdue invoices, analyzes client payment history, and decides on the appropriate next steps for debt collection (e.g., send a more firm email, make a direct call, initiate debt recovery through a specialized company).
human_nodes.trigger_condition: When an invoice is significantly overdue (e.g., beyond the initial statement of account reminder from agent_email_outreach).

human_nodes.description: Sets the overall business strategy, identifies target markets, defines service offerings, and makes high-level decisions regarding financial partnerships and resource allocation. This involves continuous learning and adapting the business model based on performance and market conditions.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Initial company setup, periodic business reviews, strategic shifts, or as needed for business growth.
outputs_for_agents: Strategic directives (e.g., market focus, new service lines)

human_nodes.description: Engages directly with clients to negotiate charge rates and payment terms, and with contractors to agree on pay rates. Handles all direct client and contractor communications, including sales pitches and relationship management. Also addresses client queries about invoices or service delivery.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: New job orders, client acquisition, contractor placement, client inquiries, or invoice disputes.

human_nodes.description: After a successful client-contractor match, guides the contractor through the available payment methods (Limited Company, PAYE, Umbrella Company), explains the implications of each, helps them choose, and oversees the onboarding process for the selected method. This includes collecting necessary documentation.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Successful candidate placement with a client.
inputs_from_agents: List of potential candidate CVs/profiles (from agent_candidate_sourcing)
outputs_for_agents: Selected payment method for each contractor
Confirmed start dates and hours for payroll processing

human_nodes.description: Resolves complex issues or disputes related to payroll, taxes, or invoices that cannot be handled by automated systems. This node actively refers back to the course material for theoretical guidance, best practices, and solutions to avoid future recurrences.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Alerts from agents regarding unresolved financial discrepancies, contractor/client complaints, or complex tax queries.

human_nodes.description: Engages with the client to understand their needs, the role, and their preference for perm, temp, or temp-to-perm. This is the start of the recruitment process from the client side.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: A new client inquiry or job requirement.
outputs_for_agents: Client's initial preferences for contract type (perm, temp, temp-to-perm)

human_nodes.description: Discusses and agrees on the specifics of the temp-to-perm arrangement or permanent placement fee structure with the client. This involves explaining the legal aspects (12-week rule), potential fee spreading, or upfront permanent fees/rebates.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client expresses interest in a candidate or role, and contract terms need to be finalized.
inputs_from_agents: Financial calculations (potential profit margins for different scenarios, rebate structures from agent_contract_tracking)

human_nodes.description: Discusses salary expectations, benefits, and the overall package with the candidate. Aims to balance candidate satisfaction with agency profitability, using strategies like asking for take-home pay.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate is strong for a role, and client is interested.
inputs_from_agents: Financial calculations (take-home pay estimates, acceptable hourly rates from agent_financial_calculator)

human_nodes.description: Reviews and approves timesheets submitted by temporary contractors before payroll processing.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Temporary contractor submits timesheet.

human_nodes.description: Conducts detailed interviews with shortlisted candidates to deeply understand their skills, experience, career goals, and underlying motivations. Crucially, this involves extracting market intelligence such as companies actively hiring, reasons for candidate dissatisfaction with previous roles, and current salary expectations in the market.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: After agent_candidate_screening_initial has provided a list of promising candidates.

human_nodes.description: Engages directly with warm client leads (generated from candidate intelligence) to initiate conversations, confirm hiring needs, and present suitable candidates. This is a personalized, value-driven outreach to leverage existing connections.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: agent_client_lead_qualification_initial identifies a high-priority warm lead.
inputs_from_agents: Prioritized client leads with contextual information

human_nodes.description: Leads client meetings to discuss recruitment fees, service agreements, and handle objections such as 'it's too expensive'. The human must actively listen to uncover the client's true concerns (e.g., unhappiness with current service, not just price) and craft tailored proposals, potentially offering exclusivity for a reduced fee.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client expresses interest but raises pricing concerns, or negotiation is initiated following client outreach.

human_nodes.description: Analyzes comprehensive market intelligence, client feedback, and the outcomes of negotiations to refine the recruitment agency's overall business strategy, pricing models, and service offerings. This includes making strategic tactical adjustments like offering exclusivity for a slightly reduced fee to gain a competitive edge.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Regular business reviews, or when recurring client objections or market shifts necessitate a strategic adjustment.

human_nodes.description: Provides personalized support, career advice, and regular check-ins with high-caliber candidates. This maintains rapport and trust, even when no immediate job is available, and can lead to future placements or referrals for new client leads.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Automated reminders from agent_candidate_relationship_management, or human initiative for key candidates.
outputs_for_agents: Potential new leads identified during conversation

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter takes the initial, in-depth job brief, understands the client's strategic hiring needs, company culture, and the urgency/difficulty of the role. Crucially, they strategize and *pitch the retained recruitment model*, explaining its benefits (exclusivity, dedicated effort, financial security for recruiter, scheduled payments for client, higher fill rate for critical/hard-to-fill roles). They negotiate terms and secure the initial upfront payment for retained assignments. They also review generated reports and make high-level decisions regarding strategy and next steps.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Client expresses a new hiring need, or agent_reporting_agent provides a progress report needing review.
inputs_from_agents: Standardized job requirement profile (for review before pitch)
Recruitment reports (e.g., market analysis for pitching retainer benefits)
outputs_for_agents: Strategic decisions (e.g., approve shortlist, offer terms)

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter conducts thorough interviews with sourced candidates, going beyond CVs to assess critical technical competencies, soft skills, cultural fit, and genuine motivation for the role and the client company (especially for complex or senior roles). They validate experience, clarify aspirations, perform competency reviews, and present the client's opportunity compellingly to the candidate. They then select the best 3-4 candidates to form the shortlist, writing comprehensive notes and summaries.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Agent_communication_agent has identified interested candidates and scheduled initial calls.

human_nodes.description: The human recruiter ensures that the successful candidate's employment contract with the client is signed, confirming the start date. They then monitor the candidate through their notice period (1-3 months) to mitigate any last-minute issues or counter-offers, ensuring a smooth transition into the new role. This stage ultimately confirms the final placement and triggers the final fee payment.
human_nodes.trigger_condition: Candidate verbally accepts the offer and the accepted offer details are finalized.

edges.condition: if documents are delayed or incomplete
if PAYE contract or specific client requirement
for post-placement support or offer rejected
if client expresses interest in candidates
if candidate is unsuitable or uninterested
client decides to make an offer
on scheduled report generation or critical alert
on deal closure or financial update
on strategic adjustments impacting client/candidate relations
If email address is obtained for intro/follow-up
If lead is qualified and interested
Always, to update client info and job needs
To send invoice and statement of account
To update debt status and actions
for payment tracking and client communication
for continuous improvement and strategic adjustments
if contract needs review or client relationship needs attention
if strategy update leads to further negotiation
Job brief provided and retainer/contingent model decided
Retainer agreement signed and upfront payment due
Progress report ready for client review
Offer accepted / remaining fee due (retained model)
Candidate started / final fee due (contingent or retained)
